programme.title: PL: Bolton v United 95/96
programme.desc: United Archives 25/2/96. With a huge trip to Newcastle looming, United looked to keep the pressure on at the top by beating struggling Bolton.

programme.title: PL: United v Nottm Forest 95/96
programme.desc: United Archives 28/4/96. United ended their home campaign against Nottingham Forest, knowing that a win would take them to the brink of the Premiership title.

programme.title: PL: United v Sunderland 96/97
programme.desc: United Archives 21/12/96. United took on Sunderland for the first time in the Premier League on what was to be a memorable afternoon at the Theatre of Dreams.

programme.title: PL: Nottm Forest v United 98/99
programme.desc: United Archives 6/2/99. Former United boss Ron Atkinson was hoping to get one over his old club when they visited the City Ground with Forest deep in relegation trouble.

programme.title: PL: United v Southampton 00/01
programme.desc: United Archives 28/10/00. United welcomed struggling Southampton looking to keep up their scintillating home form, having scored 22 goals in their opening six league contests at the Theatre of Dreams.

programme.title: PL: United v Derby 01/02
programme.desc: United Archives 12/12/2001. After 3 Successive League defeats, United hoped to rediscover their form at home to Derby.

programme.title: PL: United v Bolton 03/04
programme.desc: United Archives 16/8/03. Cristiano Ronaldo comes off the bench to make an explosive start to his Old Trafford career as the Reds face Bolton Wanderers.

programme.title: 2004 FA Cup Final
programme.desc: United Archives 22/5/04. United were clear favourites to lift the FA Cup when they faced Millwall at the Millennium Stadium in May 2004.

programme.title: PL: Arsenal v United 04/05
programme.desc: United Archives 1/2/05. United had ended the Gunners' record-breaking unbeaten run earlier in the season, both sides were now desperate for victory to keep the pressure on Chelsea at the top.

programme.title: Monster High
programme.desc: Nightmare Nightmore: Draculaura is set on hosting the perfect holiday party. But when things don't go as planned, she struggles to cope with sharing the spotlight with someone new. (S1, ep 7)

programme.title: Monster High
programme.desc: Draculaura gives her dance partner, Clawd, enchanted dancing shoes in 'Out Of Step', then in 'Pyramid Scheme', Cleo raids her family's ancient tomb for a perfect, superior costume. (S1, ep 8)

programme.title: The Thundermans
programme.desc: Phoebe's a Clone Now: When Phoebe becomes too busy, Max helps her by creating a clone so she can be in two places at once. But the clone starts making trouble for the real Phoebe! (S1, ep 8)

programme.title: The Thundermans
programme.desc: This Looks Like a Job For: Max and Phoebe get jobs at a pizza place, each trying to impress the manager. But when Max over-promises on a huge order, it could be all over. (S1, ep 9)

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: The Space Rock: Trouble follows Henry home from his superhero life when a piece of rock from outer space turns out to be more than it seems. (S1, ep 8)

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: Birthday Girl Down: Henry is not invited to a party because he is accused of throwing the birthday girl off the roof the previous year. Captain Man helps Henry clear his name. (S1, ep 9)

programme.title: Hunter Street
programme.desc: Principal: When Max gets into trouble at school, the terrifying headmistress decides she must speak with his foster parents. The kids scramble to distract her from their absence. (S1, ep 4)

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: Papa Smurf disappears in 'Where's Papa Smurf?', then in 'Who's Heftier?', Wimpy challenges Hefty to a test of strength and wins by accident! (S1, ep 4)

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: Where's My Smurfway?: When Blossom misplaces Brainy's beloved Smurfway, she has to find it before Brainy finds out. (S2, ep 2b)

programme.title: Best & Bester
programme.desc: Best and Bester decide to trick feuding magicians in 'Get Shirty', then in 'This Solves Nothing', Diamondo is holding a mystery dinner party, but Best and Bester solve a mystery for real! (S1, ep 4)

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: SpongeBob finds a nasty sea urchin living in the Krusty Krab in 'Eek, An Urchin!', and then in 'Squid's Defense', Squidward convinces SpongeBob and Sandy to teach him karate.

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: An imprisoned Plankton tries to break out of jail and steal the secret formula in 'Jailbreak!', and then in 'Evil Spatula', Spongebob replaces his broken spatula with a magical one from Plankton.

programme.title: ALVINNN!!! and the Chipmunks
programme.desc: Jeanette Enchanted: It's Jeanette's birthday but she doesn't want to celebrate it! The Chipmunks and Chipettes offer her a magical, fairy-tale birthday that they'll never forget. (S1, ep 4)

programme.title: ALVINNN!!! and the Chipmunks
programme.desc: A Room of One's Own: After squabbling with his brothers, Alvin convinces Dave to give him his own room, but soon realises living alone isn't what it's cracked up to be. (S1, ep 33)

programme.title: ALVINNN!!! and the Chipmunks
programme.desc: Lights Camera Uh-Oh: The Chipmunks have 48 hours to help Jeanette make a student film. But they all have a different movie in mind.

programme.title: ALVINNN!!! and the Chipmunks
programme.desc: My Fair Chipette: When Brittany declines Alvin's help for a talent show, he convinces Jeanette to enter, putting them at odds. (S5, ep 7b)

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: SpongeBob works the grill at the toughest joint in town in 'The Salty Sponge', then in 'Karen for Spot', Karen looks after Spot while Plankton goes out of town.

programme.title: The Loud House
programme.desc: Lori struggles to make a good impression in 'Day of the Dad', then in 'Small Blunder', desperate to have the best show-and-tell in class, Lily takes Lisa's shrink ray to school. (S6, ep 24)

programme.title: The Patrick Star Show
programme.desc: Bunny's mother visits from the old country in 'Which Witch is Which?', and then in 'Get Off My Lawnie', Granny Tentacles gets her own spin-off show. (S1, ep 25)

programme.title: The Thundermans
programme.desc: Patch Me If You Can: Phoebe visits her boyfriend's shy brother, but the mild-mannered boy discovers his evil side when he gets his hands on one of Max's inventions. (S3, ep 10)

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: The Bucket Trap: Henry and Charlotte want to tell Jasper that Henry is really Kid Danger. They decide to give Jasper a test secret to prove he's ready. (S1, ep 23)

programme.title: Monster High
programme.desc: Clawdeen must accept who she is in 'Case of the Moon-Days', then in 'Portrait of a Monster', Frankie's identity crisis during picture day makes her zap a camera into a soulsucking menace. (S1, ep 3)

programme.title: Monster High
programme.desc: Toralei & Lagoona threaten to expose Draculaura as a witch in 'Witch Hitch', then in 'Part of the Pack', Clawdeen is invited to join Monster High's werewolf pack. (S1, ep 4)

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: SpongeBob and Patrick make it their mission to reunite a band in 'Goofy Scoopers', then in 'Pat the Dog', Patrick is sent to the dog pound, but he won't be able to leave until he's trained!

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: SpongeBob and Squidward are sent to collect unpaid bills in 'Bubble Bass's Tab', then in 'Kooky Cooks', Spongebob and Squidward cook a fancy meal for Mrs. Puff, but every dish becomes a dispute.

programme.desc: Sugar & Spice & Lightning & Frights: Two new kids show up at the daycare. Duncan and Leshawna take issue with not what makes them different, but what makes them similar to the newbies. (S3 Ep8)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Construction Bear: Grizzy decides to build a building to impress she-bear. (S1 Ep40)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Kung Fu Lemmings: The Lemmings draw inspiration from lessons they find in a martial arts book and start breaking every wooden object they can get their hands on. (S1 Ep41)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: A Midsummer Bear's Dream: Grizzy dreams that he's a valiant knight but is woken up by the Lemmings blasting music. Grizzy has only one desire: pick up his dream where he left off. (S1 Ep42)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Manufacturing Secret: Grizzy has run out of chocolate spread. He realises that the Lemmings are making their own. If they can make it, then why can't he? But first, he needs the recipe! (S1 Ep43)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Bling Bling Bear: Inspired by a magazine showing a man offering a diamond to a woman, Grizzy imagines himself offering the ranger's engagement ring to his beloved she-bear. (S1 Ep44)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Intellectual Bear: When he accidentally sticks a computer microprocessor to his head, Grizzy is transformed into a being capable of predicting events to come far in advance. (S1 Ep45)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Voodoo Blanket: The Lemmings prepare a dream afternoon snack with the last jar of chocolate spread in the cupboard. (S1 Ep46)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Bear Prints: Grizzy discovers that he can print images taken with the ranger's camera which is connected to a state-of-the-art printer. (S1 Ep47)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Inspector Grizzy: A van pulls up to the ranger's cabin to deliver a crate of chocolate spread. While Grizzy and the Lemmings fight over a wrecking bar to open it, someone steals the crate. (S1 Ep48)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Oww: When the kids discover Chef's past as a disgraced pro wrestler, they invite his old tag team partner to help put on a charity show. But is the big match about reunion or revenge?! (S2 Ep32)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Jelly Aches: The school descends into chaos after getting a visit from Gazunga, the Jealousy Troll. (S2 Ep33)

programme.title: Mermicorno: Starfall
programme.desc: Total Eclipse of My Heart: The Mermicornos make a daring attempt to rescue Pearl Girl from Ika Inkblot's lair, but not everything goes according to plan. (S1 Ep113)

programme.title: New: Unicorn Academy
programme.desc: Unicorn Academy - Part 1: At Unicorn Academy, regular teen Sophia has a lot to learn about fantastical creatures, but a dark force threatens to return and destroy unicorn magic! (Ep1)

programme.title: Rainbow Butterfly Unicorn Kitty
programme.desc: The Loch Mess Monster: Miguel is so messy that a creature named the Loch Mess Monster moves in with him. (S1 Ep9)

programme.title: Rainbow Butterfly Unicorn Kitty
programme.desc: Mighty Meow And Super Lucha: Felicity and Miguel pretend to be real superheroes, drawing the wrath of a notorious supervillain named The Couch Potato. (S1 Ep10)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Fire In The Hole: Duncan cooks up a nuclear hot sauce to mess with Chef, but accidentally summons Terry Spice, King of the Underworld! (S2 Ep26)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Tu Ba Or Not Tu Ba: The class tries to help Chef achieve his dream of joining the world's most famous Tuba Band, Tubalicious, only to regret it when they realise how much they'll miss him. (S2 Ep27)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Dude Where's Macaw: While trying to defend his elite gamer status, Chef uses an old cheat code that brings a dangerous avatar to life. (S2 Ep28)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Way Back Wendel: Courtney must deliberately lose a challenge or let the entire world go back in time. It's a hard choice for her. (S2 Ep29)

programme.title: Mermicorno: Starfall
programme.desc: Mission: Mermicorno: Astra, a winged unicorn mermaid known as a Mermicorno, sets out on an adventure to find her missing sister. (S1 Ep1)

programme.title: New: Unicorn Academy
programme.desc: Unicorn Academy - Part 2: At Unicorn Academy, regular teen Sophia has a lot to learn about fantastical creatures, but a dark force threatens to return and destroy unicorn magic! (Ep2)

programme.title: Rainbow Butterfly Unicorn Kitty
programme.desc: Mythic Mounties: The friends join a scouting group, but Felicity has a hard time winning the praise of her scoutmaster and earning a merit badge. (S1 Ep19)

programme.title: Rainbow Butterfly Unicorn Kitty
programme.desc: Rainbow Butterfly Unicorn Cupid: When Moona announces she's closing Mythic Malts, Felicity tries to get Moona to fall back in love with her job, but the plan backfires. (S1 Ep20)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Supply Mum: When Chef's mum becomes the supply teacher for a day, Duncan replaces Chef's to-do list with one of his own. (S2 Ep8)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Mooshy Mon Mons: After eating Chef's extremely rare and expensive chocolates, Courtney drags Owen, Izzy and Beth all the way to the Norberian Alps of Fruffenberg to replace them. (S2 Ep9)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Student Becomes The Teacher: Chef is knocked unconscious right before a school board evaluator shows up for a big review. Now Owen has to fill in so Chef doesn't lose his teaching licence. (S2 Ep10)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Beth And The Beanstalk: After having a chocolate bar confiscated by Chef, Beth finds herself in a parallel giant world and aims to get back her now giant chocolate bar. (S2 Ep11)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: The A-bok-bok-bokalypse: When chicken pox sweeps through the school, the kids visit the Chicken Queen to apologise for past misdeeds and hopefully procure an antidote before it's too late! (S2 Ep12)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Pinata Regatta: Izzy can't bring herself to smash a pinata during Cinco de Mayo celebrations. But when that unsmashed pinata comes to life and spawns an evil pinata army, it's batter up. (S2 Ep13)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: A Dame-gerous Game: After Leshawna, Bridgette, Owen and Cody win a hide and seek contest, they're trapped on a private island by a jealous ex-champion and forced to play for their freedom. (S2 Ep14)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Royal Flush: When the other kids fear Harold has accidentally flushed himself down Chef's fancy new toilet, they travel into the sewer on a rescue mission. (S2 Ep15)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Total Eclipse Of The Fart: After accidentally swallowing her first loose tooth and fearing that means no cash under the pillow, Leshawna tries to capture the tooth fairy. (S2 Ep16)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Dissing Cousins - Part 1: It's International Cousins Day and Owen and Gwen are dreading the fact that their cousins Max and Ella are spending the day with them. (S2 Ep17)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Dissing Cousins - Part 1: It's International Cousins Day and Owen and Gwen are dreading the fact that their cousins Max and Ella are spending the day with them. (S2 Ep18)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: For A Few Duncans More: While using Chef's fancy new copier, Duncan accidentally makes an entire other Duncan. Great! But things go badly when the other Duncan decides to copy himself too. (S2 Ep19)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: He Who Wears The Clown: After trying on the nose of a clown, Owen learns that this is how clowns are made. He's stuck as a clown until he can trick someone into asking to try on the nose. (S2 Ep20)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Us 'r' Toys: Chef brings in some old toys from his childhood and he, Duncan and Gwen get magically sucked into the toys and need to find a way to get back into their own bodies. (S2 Ep21)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Dream Worriers: Izzy forgets the ending to her most amazing dream of all time, so the kids travel into her mind to find out what happened. (S2 Ep22)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Gumbearable: After accidentally swallowing a piece of gum, Owen has to protect his friends by jumping into a gum volcano. (S3 Ep1)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Whack Mirror: Chef warns Beth and Cody that making goofy faces into a mirror will cause them to get stuck that way. It turns out he was right, just not in the way any of them ever imagined. (S3 Ep2)

programme.title: Power Players
programme.desc: The Trojan Bear: A high-tech metallic bear strangely ends up at Axel's. The multi-function toy quickly wins over our hero and the Power Players - except for Bearbarian, who doesn't trust it. (S1 Ep36)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Random Bear: Grizzy and the lemmings fight over chocolate-spread jar lids, which they use as chips in a competition to win goodies. (S1 Ep16)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Lemming Interference: Grizzy has prepared himself a TV dinner, but his meal is interrupted by unexplained static. Grizzy finds that the true 'interference' is down to the lemmings. (S1 Ep17)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: High Voltage Bear Attack: The lemmings are having a party, but when Grizzy throws their ghetto blaster into the river he sparks a power cut! (S1 Ep18)

programme.title: Rainbow Butterfly Unicorn Kitty
programme.desc: Gone With The Wand: Felicity and friends find a magic wand, which they use to make crazy wishes until they can locate the wand's rightful owner. (S1 Ep11)

programme.title: Rainbow Butterfly Unicorn Kitty
programme.desc: Fountain Of Too Much Youth: When Miguel discovers his favourite malt is now on the kids menu, he drinks from the Fountain of Youth to get younger. (S1 Ep12)

programme.title: LEGO Friends: The Next Chapter
programme.desc: Decisions, Decisions: Struggling to choose only one of her friends' many ideas for what should go inside the new community center, Aliya must find a different solution. (S1 Ep8)

programme.title: Anifeiliaid Bach y Byd

programme.title: Voyage to the Planet of Prehistoric Women
programme.desc: 1968. Sci-fi. Director: Peter Bogdanovich. Stars Mamie Van Doren & Mary Marr. When a group of astronauts land on Venus they are surprised to find dangerous creatures and beautiful women. [S]

programme.title: Full Moon in Blue Water
programme.desc: 1988. Drama. Directed by Peter Masterson. Stars Gene Hackman, Teri Garr & Burgess Meredith. A lonely widower with a failing bar encounters a bus driver who is determined to turn it all around. [S]

programme.title: The Party's Over
programme.desc: 1965. Drama. Directed by Guy Hamilton. A controversial film of its time. A young American girl is caught up in the wild London scene. Starring Oliver Reed.

programme.title: The Star and the Story: Ferry to Fox Island
programme.desc: 1955. Drama. Directed by Harry Keller. Stars Jan Sterling & Mary Anderson. A woman's fianc disappears on the eve of their wedding, but there's one clue that may help her find him.

programme.title: Freedom To Die
programme.desc: 1961. Directed by Francis Searle Stars Bruce Seton, Felicity Young, Kay Callard & Paul Maxwell. Neat Crime drama of a hidden underworld where crime really doesn't pay. [S]

programme.title: Night Ride
programme.desc: 1937. Drama. Director: John Paddy Carstairs. Stars Jimmy Hanley, Wally Patch, Julian Vedey & Joan Ponsford. Two drivers, sacked by the trucking company they work for, decide to form their own. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life Single-Handed Sailors
programme.desc: 1968. Sir Francis Chichester and Sir Alec Rose have shown what it means to sail around the world single-handed - and ten men set out to prove it can be done without any stop at all.

programme.title: Of Human Bondage
programme.desc: 1934. Drama. Directed by John Cromwell. Stars Bette Davis, Leslie Howard & Frances Dee. A young man becomes attracted to a cold and unfeeling waitress who may ultimately destroy them both. [S]

programme.title: As Long as They're Happy
programme.desc: 1955. Comedy. Directed by J. Lee Thompson. Stars Jack Buchanan, Janette Scott, Jean Carson. In England, an American singer causes havoc when he stays with a stockbroker's family by mistake. [S]

programme.title: Broken Journey
programme.desc: 1948. Drama. Directors: Ken Annakin & Michael C Chorlton. Stars Phyllis Calvert, James Donald & David Tomlinson. A plane crash lands miles from civilisation. The passengers must prevail. [S]

programme.title: What's On TPTV With Noel
programme.desc: Founder of Talking Pictures TV and one half of the Footage Detectives, Noel Cronin, shares shows and films not to be missed at the beginning of April. [S]

programme.title: A Tale Of Two Cities
programme.desc: 1958. Drama. Directed by Ralph Thomas. Stars Dirk Bogarde, Dorothy Tutin, Cecil Parker & Stephen Murray. During the French Revolution, Lucie Manette falls in love with a duplicitous Englishman. [S]

programme.title: The Man In The Iron Mask
programme.desc: 1977. Adventure. Director: Mike Newell. Stars Richard Chamberlain & Patrick McGoohan. D'Artagnan and the musketeers plot to replace the hated King Louis XIV with his imprisoned twin brother. [S]

programme.title: Genevieve
programme.desc: 1953. Comedy. Director Henry Cornelius. Stars Kenneth More, Dinah Sheridan and Kay Kendall. Alan and Ambrose are not going to let friendship get in the way of winning the London to Brighton rally. [S]

programme.title: Strange But True
programme.desc: Cursed Stone/Phantom Hitch Hiker. 1995. Michael Aspel explores two strange tales; the modern myth of the phantom hitchhiker and a cursed burial place on one of the Outer Hebrides islands. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: Wander down into The Cellar Club if you dare, as tonight there is a great selection of horror and thrills. Caroline Munro introduces the first offering, from 1971, Doomwatch - No Room for Error. [S]

programme.title: Doomwatch
programme.desc: No Room for Error. 1971. Stars Jean Trend, Simon Oates & Angus MacKay. Doomwatch investigates when the 'wonder drug' Stellamycin is linked to the deaths of several children. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: Caroline Munro continues the night with the fascinating Spanish horror, The Vampires Night Orgy. From 1972, this supernatural feature full of bloodthirsty vampires is directed by Len Klimovsky. [S]

programme.title: The Vampires Night Orgy
programme.desc: 1972. Horror. Directed by Len Klimovsky. Stars Jack Taylor & Dyanik Zurakowska. A busload of workers stop off in a small town after their driver dies, unaware the town is overrun with vampires. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: Join Caroline Munro as she takes a look at what's coming up next week. [S]

programme.title: The Claim
programme.desc: 2000. Romance. Director: Michael Winterbottom. Stars Peter Mullan, Milla Jovovich & Wes Bentley. A man who sold his wife and daughter to get ahead in business has his past come back to haunt him. [S]

programme.title: The Claim
programme.desc: 2000. Romance. Director: Michael Winterbottom. Stars Peter Mullan, Milla Jovovich & Wes Bentley. A man who sold his wife and daughter to get ahead in business has his past come back to haunt him. [S]

programme.title: Midnight Fear
programme.desc: 1990. Crime thriller directed by Bill Crain and starring David Carradine, Pete Atkins and Mark Carlton. Detective Hanks must track down two psychotic killers before they kill again. [S]

programme.title: Kill Her Gently
programme.desc: 1957. Thriller. Directed by Charles Saunders. Stars Griffith Jones, Maureen Connell & Marc Lawrence. Two convicts who escape prison are picked up by a motorist who helps them on the run. [S]

programme.title: Time To Remember
programme.desc: The Time of Three Kings. 1964. Narrated by Sir Michael Redgrave. It's 1936, Edward VIII becomes King, the Olympic Games are in Germany, there's war in Spain, then George VI becomes the new King. [S]

programme.title: Dick Tracy (1937)
programme.desc: 1937. Thriller. Directors: Alan James & Ray Taylor. Stars Ralph Byrd, Kay Hughes & Smiley Burnette. A criminal puts the famous detective's brother under a spell and turns him against his sibling.

programme.title: Black Saddle
programme.desc: 1959. The Return. Western with Peter Breck. After his brothers are killed in a shootout, a gunfighter decides to hang up his guns and uphold the law by becoming a lawyer.

programme.title: Space Patrol
programme.desc: The Slaves of Neptune. 1963. Stars Mary Dean, Libby Morris, Ronnie Stevens. A spaceship carrying colonists to Pluto disappears. Whilst investigating this, the crew fall under a hypnotic influence. [S]

programme.title: Batman
programme.desc: The Clock King's Crazy Crimes. 1966. Stars Adam West & Walter Slezak. The Clock King arranges for one of his trick timepieces to be sold to the Harry Hummert Jewellery Shop so he can loot it. [S]

programme.title: Richard the Lionheart
programme.desc: The Wolf of Banbury. 1962. Stars Dermot Walsh, Frances De Wolff, John Bennett. Richard learns that Baron Giles is giving protection to fugitives from justice and that he has captured Lady Rosalie. [S]

programme.title: Phantom Creeps
programme.desc: Thundering Rails. 1939. Stars Bela Lugosi, Robert Kent & Edwin Stanley. Dr Zorka is determined to recover his meteorite from the agents. [S]

programme.title: Runaway Railway
programme.desc: 1965. Adventure. Directed by Jan Darnley-Smith. Stars John Moulder-Brown, Kevin Bennett, Leonard Brockwell, Sydney Tafler & Ronnie Barker. Children foil crooks and re-open an old branch line. [S]

programme.title: The Adventures of Robin Hood
programme.desc: The Oath. 1960. Stars Richard Greene, Alexander Gauge & John Arnatt. The Deputy Sheriff attempts to trick Friar Tuck in order to prove that the priest colludes with the outlaws. [S]

programme.title: Phantom Planet
programme.desc: 1961. Sci-fi. Directed by William Marshall. Stars Dean Fredericks, Coleen Gray & Anthony Dexter. An astronaut discovers a population of tiny beings living on an invisible asteroid. [S]

programme.title: One Step Beyond
programme.desc: Epilogue. 1959. Starring Julie Adams, Charles Herbert and Charles Aidman. A recovering alcoholic is pushed to his limits when his family is trapped in a collapsed mine. [S]

programme.title: Dick Barton: Special Agent
programme.desc: 1979. Writer: Clive Exton. Dick's Aunt (Stella Kemball) tells him that her house has vanished. Richard Marley reveals that Harold Jenkins (Peter Godfrey) has perfected his ultimate weapon.

programme.title: Fireball XL-5
programme.desc: The Forbidden Planet. 1963. Stars David Graham, John Bluthal & Paul Maxwell. Whilst working on a space station, Prof. Matic and Dr. Stamp are kidnapped by angry residents of the planet Nutopia.

programme.title: Captain Scarlet and the Mysterons
programme.desc: Point 783. 1967. Stars Elizabeth Morgan, Paul Maxwell & Francis Matthews. Scarlet and Blue are assigned to escort the Supreme Commander to SHEF HQ after the Mysterons threaten his life.

programme.title: Hobson's Choice
programme.desc: 1954. Drama. Director: David Lean. Stars Charles Laughton, John Mills & Brenda de Banzie. Henry Hobson's three daughters want to marry, but he refuses as traditions require him to pay settlements. [S]

programme.title: The Ghost of Rashmon Hall
programme.desc: 1948. Horror. Directed by Denis Kavanagh. Stars Valentine Dyall, Anne Howard, Alec Faversham & Howard Douglas. A doctor is summoned to an old, dark manor to clear the house of evil spirits. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life Hot History
programme.desc: 1968. A brilliant look at the work of the Press Association with its teleprinters and fast movement to get the news out.

programme.title: Z-Cars
programme.desc: Kidnap. 1976. Stars Ralph Arliss, Bruce Boa, Don Fellows, James Ellis, Douglas Fielding, Garrick Hagon & Mark Jones. A rag week kidnap for charity starts out all right... [S]

programme.title: A Family At War
programme.desc: The War Office Regrets. Created by John Finch. Stars Colin Douglas & Shelagh Fraser. Mystery hangs over the fate of John Porter. Whilst on leave David is forced to face up to his actions. [S]

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: How To Train Your Plant: She-Bear is going on holiday and leaves Bear with her "pet" - a flycatcher. Masha, of course, knows better than anyone how to treat the flycatcher. (S5 Ep21)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: The Mystery Guest: Somebody terribly scary has climbed into the house of Penguin and made a terrible mess there! Bear rushes down to Antarctica to help, and Masha tags along with him. (S5 Ep22)

programme.title: Bubble's Hotel
programme.desc: Ballet Smash: Bubble is thrilled to show Tutu her new ballerina room. (S1 Ep1)

programme.title: Bubble's Hotel
programme.desc: Hold Your Seahorses: Bubble gives Delphina some seahorse-riding lessons to help her fulfil her lifelong dream of riding a wild seahorse. (S1 Ep2)

programme.title: Hello Kitty: Super Style!
programme.desc: Sing Out Loud - Pop Star Kitty: The famous singer Podo Pooch is in town! Rio is desperate to sing with her, and lacks the confidence to sing his heart out. (S1 Ep1)

programme.title: Hello Kitty: Super Style!
programme.desc: Treasure Hunters - Explorer Kitty: Badtz Maru and P.I. are determined to treasure hunt at the ancient Penguinese Temple. But they always get lost! Explorer Kitty tries to lead her friends. (S1 Ep2)

programme.title: Hello Kitty: Super Style!
programme.desc: A Good Sport - Athlete Kitty: Zing has always been the champion of Cherry Town...until Vastus arrives and challenges her to a competition. (S1 Ep3)

programme.title: Hello Kitty: Super Style!
programme.desc: The Legend Of Sweet Tooth - Detective Kitty: When the marshmallows disappear during a camping trip, everyone thinks the legendary monster Sweet Tooth must've taken them. (S1 Ep4)

programme.title: Hello Kitty: Super Style!
programme.desc: Disappearing Act - Detective Kitty: When Keroppi disappears after a magic trick, Detective Kitty tries to track him down. (S1 Ep5)

programme.title: Hello Kitty: Super Style!
programme.desc: A Berry Long Wait - Chef Kitty: When the snack truck closes, Frido is frustrated she can't get a smoothie. But Chef Kitty has the recipe for saving the day, whether Frido likes it or not! (S1 Ep6)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: Princess Or Dragon?: A snow tower? Check. A group of friends? Check. Sounds like a recipe for a fun game! Even Bear joined Masha, Rosie, and Penguin. But who will be the Princess? (S5 Ep23)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: Happily Feather After: Spring has dawned, the birds have arrived! But a pigeon settles in the birdhouse near Bear's house, and Masha makes him her new pet. (S5 Ep24)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: Fast And Furrryous: Bear has made a new purchase: he's bought a motorcycle! Now as a cool biker, he plans on impressing She-Bear, but she doesn't seem to like it very much. (S5 Ep25)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: Unbearable Beach: On a nice summer's day Bear, as usual, goes fishing. But the fishing trip didn't quite work out: the forest dwellers made a "beach" at Bear's favourite spot. (S5 Ep26)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: When a Pig Flies: Rosie has lost her peace because of the ripe, appetising acorns growing right above her little snout. (S6 Ep1)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: All You Need is a Goal: The ball is on the field, the players are in the field, the Bear in the chair is rooting for his favourite team. But Masha got bored in anticipation of a goal. (S6 Ep2)

programme.title: Go! Go! Cory Carson
programme.desc: School Play: Cory is sure he's going to get the starring role of the school play, but when he loses out on the part, he needs to learn about what it means to fill a supporting role. (S1 Ep61)

programme.title: Go! Go! Cory Carson
programme.desc: Garage Sale: The Carsons have a competitive garage sale; whoever sells the most gets to decide where the family goes for vacation. (S1 Ep62)

programme.title: Go! Go! Cory Carson
programme.desc: Cory's First Day: Cory is really excited and a bit nervous about his first day at Bumperton Hills Motorsorri school. (S1 Ep1)

programme.title: Go! Go! Cory Carson
programme.desc: Chrissy's Best Friend: When Chrissy adopts an unlikely friend, Cory needs to do everything he can to keep her new friend out of danger. (S1 Ep2)

programme.title: Go! Go! Cory Carson
programme.desc: Garbage Day: Cory's dream comes true when his hero, Gary Garbage, invites him to be a Junior Garbage Apprentice for the day. (S1 Ep3)

programme.title: Go! Go! Cory Carson
programme.desc: Firehouse: Freddie's mom gives Cory and the crew an unforgettable tour of the firehouse. (S1 Ep4)

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Luna Goes Too Far: Luna deviously inveigles the PJMs into her plan to disempower Motsuki. (S5 Ep3)

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Owly Tricks: Owlette is teaching Owl lots of stunts and tricks. But Romeo wants some Owl-y power of his own. (S5 Ep4)

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Newton The Destructor: Newton turns bad due to a psychoactive asteroid. (S5 Ep5)

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Luna Kazoomer: When Newton turns his back on his space powers, Luna exploits him to get back to the moon. (S5 Ep6)

programme.title: Billy The Cowboy Hamster
programme.desc: Good As Gold: Having read about gold prospectors in a Jessy Dog comic, Billy, Jean-Claude and Suzie set off for the mountain, full of hope, to look for gold in the river. (S1 Ep1)

programme.title: Billy The Cowboy Hamster
programme.desc: The New Librarian: Impatient to read the latest issue of the Adventures of Jessy Dog, Billy sets off with Jean-Claude for Miss Goatie's stagecoach-library. (S1 Ep2)

programme.title: Billy The Cowboy Hamster
programme.desc: No Birthday without Hazelnuts: Today is Jean-Claude's birthday! To celebrate, Billy and Suzie have decided to make a fantastic hazelnut birthday cake with him. JC is thrilled!(S1 Ep3)

programme.title: Billy The Cowboy Hamster
programme.desc: Rodeo Stars: Discovering that Jessy Dog takes part in rodeos, Billy decides he wants to do the same. But how will he manage without a horse? Scott's rocking chair will do just fine! (S1 Ep4)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: Wranglin' Thunderfoot: When Jon wrongly accuses Thunderfoot of scaring their dino herds, he creates trouble for Thunderfoot and for himself. (S2 Ep1)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: Wings Over Dino Ranch: When the Tinhorn Trio pick a field of glowing moon lilies, they accidentally prevent a flock of pterosaurs from finding their way home at night. (S2 Ep2)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: Bathtime for Bopper: Clover loves being clean and is eager to help Min bathe the dino mites, but stubborn baby Bopper wants to stay dirty. (S2 Ep3)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: Min Flies Solo: When Maggie the pterosaur hurts her wing, Min needs to copy Jon and Miguel's skills in order to help her. (S2 Ep4)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: Tango Dino-Sits: When Tango is asked to babysit the dino mites, she underestimates how big the job will be. (S2 Ep5)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: The Ten Gallon Trophy: When Bopper runs off with Bo's prized Ten Gallon Trophy Hat, Tango believes that she has to be like Blitz and Clover in order to help the gang. (S1 Ep17)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: Plane Crazy: When Miguel underestimates his dino pals and gets carried away by his dream of flying, he learns that he needs to believe in his dino-friends as much as he believes in an idea. (S1 Ep18)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: The Mighty Dino Mites: When Blitz's favorite stuffy goes missing, the dino mites team up to track down the culprit and save the day. (S2 Ep17)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: Home Sweet Home: When Clover tries to help a wild Rhinorex by bringing her home with him, the lovably messy dinosaur soon causes problems for her new Dino Ranch friends. (S2 Ep18)
